name: hexjumper
text: A comment left by hexjumper was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by littlecat, jdhenry105, sid, gorrioncita, griggs_although)

name: catachresis
text: Damn, dude. I was just going to say something like "I really love this strip, it is so goddamn sweet" but you brought the sack in terms of laying it out.

name: catachresis
text: I do so love this strip.

name: i_love_kate
text: It is pretty sweet.

name: tim_simmons
text: it is.

name: c_dizzle
text: "sweetest" is also the first word that came to mind... damnitall! i never have novel ideas!

name: zefiel
text: Dudes shut up, his original comment has 104 chubbies, what else do you want

name: heccibiggs
text: It had 104 chubbies when you commented a month ago? Shit, that means it's culminated 37 new chubbies in the space of a month. DAMN.

name: doc_rostov
text:
It slowed down a mite bit in the last month, as it only picked up 19 from where it was when you made your post. You know, Ms. Heccibiggs, this would make quite an interesting line graph!

Depending on your definition of interesting, I suppose.

name: tekende
text: It would just barely fall within acceptable parameters for my definition of "interesting." Just barely.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Personally, I think it would be pretty fly, but sadly there is no way of tracking it's past progress. I mean we could start recording it from this point onwards - checking back, say, once every week and noting the number of chubbies, over an extended period of time. However, I feel it would have been more worthwhile if we could have tracked it from the beginning - it's hayday of chubby-receiving is probably long over.

What happened, I started that comment with pretty normal speech and ended up almost Cornelius-ish with a hint of maths-geek.

name: i_love_kate
text: I think you mean "Heyday".

name: heccibiggs
text: Argh. Y'know, when I wrote it, I thought "maybe it's 'hey', not 'hay'", but I didn't bother to Google it. Such is the way of the pathologically lazy...

name: i_love_kate
text: Not a "Biggs" mistake. Har har... har...

name: chachibenji
text:
Oof. Was so corny, face fell off.
Chub for effort tho.

name: gumfish
text: Guys. We must have more graphs up in here.

name: stereo
text: 211 chubbies, July 19 2008.

name: belgand
text: 245 Chubbies, excluded because of 3 Lames as of October 16, 2008

name: heccibiggs
text: Just increase your lame threshold, brah.

name: belgand
text: I did, but I included it because 3 is the default setting which means that it will see decreased viewing from now on by people.

name: apocowarg
text: 287 chubbies and 4 lames, April 3, 2009.

name: appers
text: 317/5, September 13th, 2009. I have no idea what people are finding so offensive in that post that they lame it.

name: jarretc
text: 365/5 June 23 2010.  GOD HELP ME I DON'T SEE AN END TO THIS!!

name: johnnybaverage
text: 380/5 on September 7, 2010.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: It is the sweetest song, played on the prettiest guitar.

name: sixtyswine
text: He brought wicked sack.

name: hexjumper
text: You know what else is intertesting, that I just noticed? Beef doesn't sing Barry White or something romantic - what he sings is almost a nursery rhyme.

name: awko
text: The airplane song fits perfectly to the tune of the Oompa Loompa song

name: missbee
text: Nooooo!

name: ford
text: i definitely just gave this post Chubby number 69.

name: spinynorman
text: Monk is such a nutty-ass motherfucker

name: dorothypoopbot
text: Did he entreat his lady to play at Whist?

name: wite_rabit
text: There ought to be a way for chubbies to overload lames...

name: aargh
text: What the hell sid? Seriously, sid; what the hell? I haven't forgotten you, littlecat, your next. But seiriously, sid, what the hell?

name: likeiwassaying
text: the people that lamed this make me do a :(

name: unprotected
text: Yeah, but after reading over what Roast Beef says a little more closely, it sorta brings to mind a 747 barreling towards some giraffes.  (The giraffes would be grazing peacefully.)

name: link
text: 359 Chubbies over 5 Lames on May 17th, 2010

name: cryptfiend85
text: A comment left by cryptfiend85 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, straw, UntilYouAreSoNude, Zefiel, beansdooma, hellofyellin, riotdejaneiro, Overmedicated, wildcat, Jesler729, Deusoma, re5urgam, Catachresis, GMM, mortshire, bug, meowmix, brzbee, Carrot, suprememongoose, nutmeg, Doc_Rostov, stormagnet)

name: hellofyellin
text:
I ain't gonna fire up my u-hauls to carry my junk six feet! That is certainly Wasteful!

Doth our lover's potpourri befoul m'lady's honker?

How does it feel to be so wrong?

Does it hurt?

name: zefiel
text:
OH HE IS YOUR MOM AND HE TOOK YOU TO SCHOOL IN THE CAR OF PAIN!

SAY IT!

name: dumase
text: A comment left by dumase was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sabbac, wildcat, 7th_shot, TonyHighwind, gethen, stormagnet)

name: zefiel
text: I just love that phrase of Beef's. I think it is pretty good when not used right in the comments of its strip.

name: hellofyellin
text:
I agree.

But man, here I thought that playfully pointing out the obviously hilarious lines in this strip would impress all these people who are enthusiastic about debate.

How wrong was I, huh?

name: hellofyellin
text: That'll show me for disagreeing with someone!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: IT!

name: radarjammer
text: Why wasteful is capitalised is beyond me, but your are correct at the cre sir.

name: catachresis
text: Beef puts his arm across his forehead in an Olde-Worlde style to deliver his line. There is so much good about this damn strip.

name: epicurus
text: This strip is very beautiful.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: I tried the "airplane/zoo" song on my girlfriend in bed. She didn't like it. I don't blame her. Molly's a special gal.

name: dak
text: The reason it's endearing in the strip is because it's pretty obvious beef just thought of it on the spot and went for it.  Using lines from a comic strip on your girlfriend in bed on the other hand strikes me as a bit..., odd.

name: jdhenry105
text: By odd you mean lame.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: BUT I QUOTE ACHEWOOD IN REAL LIFE ALL THE TIME

name: sevenslashfour
text: By lame you mean heck of lame.

name: julia
text: Oh those sweet and silly moments in bed.  This strip cemented my now-raging crush on Beef.

name: carrot
text: Man this strip is one of those rare moments where every little thing is perfect. 1) We don't see Beef coming back from the dead, making the focus Molly and Beef's love 2) They don't have a nice life, they're poor as crap, which again makes us focus on their love and 3) Beef is just so happy. How can you not love seeing Beef happy?

name: norrin
text:
All the hints of poverty were a nice touch. Very naturalist look.

I think it speaks volumes about the kind of girl Molly is that, once outside of heaven, finding out Beef was dirt poor and that she'd be sleeping on a mattress on the floor was not a deal breaker for her.

name: niggar
text: Evidently you can have a DVD player and a Netflix account and still be considered poor as crap.  Oh, America.

name: terriblerobot
text: Dude, have you ever been to a trailer park? It's almost required that you have the biggest TV you can fit through the door, and a fancy stereo system to go with it. Everything else about the place will be cheap, broken, or old save for the items which provide mind-numbing entertainment. The main exception is usually the computer; if there is one at all, it is usually an ancient Dell or IBM running Windows ME, with a 15 inch monitor. It will be shoved into a corner, in the dark, and surrounded by empties and potato chip bags.

name: achilleselbow
text: A comment left by achilleselbow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Rhadamanthus, Deusoma, dominus101, captneko)

name: gmm
text: Y'know what's sad? I kinda do.

name: moraiat
text: Roast Beef's "lamp" is made out of a Pepsi can...

name: ovenface
text: I've got a lamp made out of a tab can. It was all the rage in middle school metal shop.

name: littlefatdog
text: Wow this strip just elevated itself above all other comic strips in history in yet another way.

name: stuart
text: Isn't he usually naked?

name: gormster
text: THAT IS EXACTLY WHAT I WAS ABOUT TO SAY

name: endoftheworld
text: I suspect the same cartoon logic that dictates Donald Duck wearing a towel around his usually bare duck ass when exiting the shower is also in play here.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Maybe naked RB is like that time Philippe shaved his head to look like Harry Potter.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Only... on the other end.

name: pr0ncess
text: I love how the shape of Molly's body under the blanket hasn't changed in over three years!

name: meowmix
text: This strip, among other things, is a great example of well-written dialogue. Their sweet, witty bantering really comes off true to life.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: This set up is way too much like my college dorm room and the conversation reminds me way too much of how i talked to my girlfriend at the time when we were still blissed out on love and no parents. Sometimes I wish I didn't have so much in common with Roast Beef.

name: mystkmanat
text:
Blissed out on love

I just wanted to tell you that that is a really beautiful phrase. (chubs)

name: tagrineth
text:
... cat condoms

wouldn't they tear? they must be made of some mad rugget material

name: tagrineth
text: ohmygodtypo - should say "rugged"

name: mystkmanat
text: They gotta be mad rugget for gettin mad rutty

name: edgy
text:
I guess it's Molly's knee, but that shadow on the covers rather looks like a 11 yo tried to make a bad penis joke.
I'll also add that the cuteness of the strip really disturbs me, but I love molly's last line, funk fairy.

name: alaric101
text:
And they lived happily...

I wanna see what happened between Molly and Grandma K...

name: hateandwar
text: He actually goes into it in the blogs, mostly Molly's but Beef probably mentions it a few times too.

name: mrclumpy
text: A comment left by mrclumpy was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hateandwar, fakead, TonyHighwind)

name: hateandwar
text: There is nothing romantic about XKCD, it is creepy, fetishistic nerd fantasy bullmess.

name: tonyhighwind
text: I agree with everything but "bullmess."

name: cpnglxynchos
text: bull honkey?

name: mangtastic
text: Man, I have heard much on how awesome the "romantic" aspects of xkcd are and I have ne'er heard so much as a word otherwise.  Thank you for REVERSING that, hateandwar.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: maaaaaaaaaaadd hate on xkcd up ins.

name: lawdog
text: This strip is a Thing.

name: tonyhighwind
text: You can totally distinguish Molly from Beef in the first panel.

name: agentstinky
text: Man I got a coupla friends that just leave their foils and spoils all over the place. I mean I don't mind too much but I didn't need to know the dude uses Magnums

name: cpnglxynchos
text: when you are real-life Lyle, you gotta have low standards.

name: puguglypress
text: Great transition from Beef getting his neck snapped

name: sevenslashfour
text: This strip is incredibly sweet. So sweet that I can't hold a grudge against it for making me go back several strips to the last one with Beef in it, just to make sure that no, he really doesn't usually wear pants.
